summary: This is a formal request from the U.S. Department of Justice to the Central Authority of France for mutual legal assistance in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. It outlines the charges against Maxwell for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls from approximately 1994 to 1997, requests confidentiality, and seeks to interview a witness in France ahead of Maxwell's July 2021 trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the prosecution and this mutual legal assistance request. She is accused of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to recruit, groom, and facilitate the sexual abuse of minor victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a U.S. national who sexually abused minor girls. His criminal conduct, which Maxwell allegedly facilitated, is the basis for the ongoing investigation and Maxwell's prosecution.

persons.name: Thomas N. Burrows
persons.role: Deputy Director, Office of International Affairs
persons.context: Signed the mutual legal assistance request on behalf of the U.S. Department of Justice, Criminal Division.

connections.description: Maxwell is alleged to have conspired with, assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Epstein's sexual abuse of minor victims.
The document implies Maxwell worked with and for Epstein in the recruitment and grooming of victims.

events.title: Period of Alleged Criminal Activity
events.description: The timeframe during which Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly conspired with Jeffrey Epstein to recruit, groom, and facilitate the sexual abuse of minor victims.

events.title: Epstein Indictment by Grand Jury
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment against Jeffrey Epstein for sex trafficking of minors.

events.title: Epstein Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested based on the indictment and detained pending trial in New York.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in his jail cell.

events.title: Maxwell Indictment by Grand Jury
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in Epstein's crimes, including conspiracy and perjury.

events.title: Maxwell Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested pursuant to the indictment and detained pending trial in New York.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for Maxwell
events.description: The trial of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to begin on this date in federal court for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The U.S. is formally requesting France's assistance to interview a witness as part of the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell, highlighting the international scope of the investigation.
The document stresses extreme confidentiality to prevent witness tampering, evidence destruction, or alerting other subjects, indicating the sensitivity of the ongoing probe.
It confirms the investigation into Epstein's conduct remained open after his death and expanded to uncover additional criminal behavior by Epstein and his associates, including Maxwell.
Maxwell is charged specifically with conspiracy, transporting minors for illegal sexual activity, and perjury for lying under oath about her role in facilitating the abuse.
The request seeks to ensure the MLAT request is kept in a separate file from any potential French criminal case file to prevent disclosure to third parties, including civil parties.
